meanings.sent1: She always prebuys her concert tickets to make sure she gets good seats.
meanings.sent2: He prebuys his groceries online to save time at the store.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prebuys nuts for the winter, so it doesn't go hungry.
meanings.sent4: Planning ahead, she prebuys all her school supplies before the new semester starts.
meanings.sent5: To avoid last-minute rush, he prebuys his train tickets for the holiday trip.

meanings.definition: Purchases made before the actual time of use.
meanings.sent1: Her prebuys of snacks for the party were a hit with the guests.
meanings.sent2: The company's prebuys of raw materials helped them avoid shortages during peak season.
meanings.sent3: The closet was filled with prebuys of clothes she bought on sale.
meanings.sent4: His collection of prebuys included rare books and vintage records.
meanings.sent5: The garage was stacked with prebuys of car parts for future repairs.
